alert.note: Alert for Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 9:45PM CST until March 08 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River at Monticello affecting Piatt County. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River at Monticello. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural areas begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CST Tuesday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sangamon River Monticello 13.0 13.2 Tue 9 pm CST 12.4 11.5 10.6 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to prepare for flooding. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
